title: Shrawley Woods Walking Route

images.title: P L Chadwick / Farmland adjacent to Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Farmland adjacent to Shrawley Wood. This view is from one of the paths on the edge of the wood. The woodland in the far distance is another part of Shrawley Wood. Although difficult to see, there is a tractor working in the field (towards the left of the picture).

images.title: P L Chadwick / Path through Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Path through Shrawley Wood. This is a public footpath, but this part of the wood is public access land and offers many alternative paths.

images.title: P L Chadwick / Farmland adjacent to Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Farmland adjacent to Shrawley Wood

images.title: P L Chadwick / Main entrance to Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Main entrance to Shrawley Wood. This entrance is reached by the short lane coming up from Shrawley Village. The gate is for emergency use only. Cars cannot be brought up here, as there is no parking here, nor in the lane iself, which is narrow and gives access to the houses adjacent to it.

images.title: Philip Halling / New Pool, Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: New Pool, Shrawley Wood. Pool created by damming the brook through Shrawley Wood.

images.title: Philip Halling / Stepping stones, Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: These stepping stones in Shrawley Wood cross Dick Brook.

images.title: P L Chadwick / Looking back at the entrance to Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking back at the entrance to Shrawley Wood. This view is just inside the wood, looking back at the entrance. Just before the gate, another path through the wood goes off to the right.

images.title: P L Chadwick / Path on the edge of Shrawley Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Path on the edge of Shrawley Wood

description: Enjoy a circular walk around this attractive area of woodland near Worcester. There are miles of good woodland trails, a riverside path along the River Severn and several large ponds to enjoy. The woods are very popular with walkers during the springtime as you will find carpets of pretty bluebells. The area near the village hall is known as the grove and has a stream running through a lovely wooded valley, with lots of pretty flowers and vegetation. The Severn Way runs past the woods so you can pick this up to extend your walk. The woods are located close to Stourport-on-Severn where you will find Hartlebury Common which has more nice woodland trails to try. Our Stourport Circular Walk visits the common, the River Severn and the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal. You could also visit Witley Court which is located only a few miles to the west. Here you will find a palatial 19th century mansion surrounded by beautiful gardens.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the south east is the worthy village of Ombersley where you'll find a number of interesting timber framed properties, an ancient 15th century pub and the historic Ombersley House Estate.
